oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Substitute papers for W. A. Winfrey
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Substitution papers for W. A. Winfrey of Fayette County, Tennessee. Winfrey enlisted in the Confederate Army on October 25, 1863, to serve three years. The document states that Winfrey is "entitled to an honorable discharge by reason of having furnished a substitute." The "substitute" was born in Ireland, is 24 years old, 5'10", with brown hair, blue eyes, and a fair complexion. His occupation is listed as shoe maker. A complete physical description of Winfrey is also included.
